metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5119 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The reader view will display cross-origin content when CORS headers are set to prohibit the loading of cross-origin content by a site. This could allow access to content that should be restricted in reader view. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
